channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report E-2024010148
item.description:
Report E-2024010148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1-55 gal dm of G375LB81208 U-Haul White arrived damaged with a puncture to the side of the drum releasing 1 gallon of product to the trailer floor. No Drains, Soil or waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report X-2024010305
item.description:
Report X-2024010305

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet box found while unloading trailer. Box brought to QA. DescribePack: One of the 2 plastic bottles of Zep Industrial Degreaser's cap was loose and some of the liquid spilled out into the box and onto the other plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Both plastic bottle's caps were screwed on tighter.

item.title: Report X-2024010089
item.description:
Report X-2024010089

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-26
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WERE PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL PPE/TUBS WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.
